newsitem.title: DENMARK: DANISH SHARES CONTINUE RISING ON H1 RESULTS.
newsitem.headline: DANISH SHARES CONTINUE RISING ON H1 RESULTS.

text.p: Danish share prices continued to rise on Thursday , fuelled by encouraging figures in the first batch of first-half 1997 corporate results and hopes of more to come.
By 0800 GMT the KFX top-20 index was up 0.25 point to 185.78.
As expected, Novo Nordisk and SAS -- both of which published better than expected results on Wednesday -- were among the leaders.
Novo was up three crowns, to 715.00 and SAS rose six crowns to 120.00.
Dealers expected Novo to stabilise but said that SAS could rise further.
"It's a bit difficult to say with SAS because it's mainly a big trader who sets the agenda," a dealer said. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom (45) 33969650
